blog.name: westeroswisdom

blog.description:
Conventional wisdom is coming to Westeros (and Essos).
We size up who's up, who's down, and who's treading water.

summary: Gendry is part Targaryen.
title: Gendry is part Targaryen.
body:
Gendry is the bastard son of Robert Baratheon. That has been known since Season 1. What often gets overlooked is that Robert’s grandmother was Rhaelle Targaryen, daughter of King Aegon V Targaryen and niece of Maester Aemon of the Night’s Watch. Rhaelle married Ormond Baratheon; their only child was Steffon Baratheon who was father to Robert, Stannis, and Renly.  
So that makes Rhaelle Targaryen Gendry’s great-grandmother.

We now know that Jon Snow is the son of Rhaegar Targaryen and therefore the great-grandson of both Jaehaerys II Targaryen AND Shaera Targaryen who were siblings of Rhaelle Targaryen. That makes Jon and Gendry third cousins because they share King Aegon V Targaryen as an ancestor.

These relationships may have been brought up elsewhere at various times, but with the series just six episodes away from conclusion, Gendry’s connection to the House Targaryen might become more relevant.

Here is a portion of the Targaryen family tree as it relates to Robert Baratheon. Of course Cersei’s three offspring were Baratheons in name though not in genetic parentage.

Here is the parent image showing more of the Targaryen line. 

From Season 1: Ned Stark meets Gendry.

summary: Hello, my lovelies!
body:
Hello, my lovelies!

I am writing…and writing…and writing! This looks like it will be another long chapter, but here’s looking at a weekend update for Shadows.

Also, we are looking at no longer than 15 chapters, so yes, the story will reach it inevitable conclusion.

But until then! Off to keep up with my lovely, stubborn couple. 😁

blog.name: pardonmymannerssir
blog.title: Pardon My Manners
blog.description: Fic writer by day, procrastinator by night.

summary: something in the way you move
title: something in the way you move
body:
Just a little Jonsa drabble I wrote as a companion to this.

She can feel him watching her.

Can feel the way his eyes follow the sway of her hips and the length of her legs as she walks. It’s intoxicating, being the focus of such intensity. She bites her lip, scanning the crowded hall till she spots him leaning against his locker, arms crossed over his chest. It’s crazy how attuned she is to him, how just looking at him can set her heart racing, and it’s both terrifying and empowering. She ducks her head and pushes into the crowd, clutching her biology book to her chest as if it might keep her from floating away. People side-eye her and no one stops her as she presses toward her locker. A week ago this would have bothered her, but now… now she has the undivided attention of the only person who matters.

Their lockers are close enough that she can hear Theon call his name and the resulting conversation. She shoves her books into her locker and seizes her opening.

“Hey Theon,” she says, though she has a hard time looking away from Jon.

“Hey, San, didn’t see you at the game last night,” Theon replies, appraising her with unabashed approval. She doesn’t take it too personally, Theon is harmless, but Jon flexes his hand a few times, shoulders tensing.

“Yeah, I had, uh, homework,” she lies, praying she isn’t blushing too obviously.

In truth she’d snuck out her bedroom window to make out with Jon in the guest house for several wonderful, perfect hours. She’d been a distracted mess all morning remembering the way he’d pressed her back into the couch and slipped his hand up her loose shorts, palming her ass as he’d ground into her. She can’t stop herself from chancing a glance, and the heat in his eyes tell her she’s not the only one remembering.

Theon snorts, and she looks quickly away before she loses all sense and does something stupid, like kiss him. “Laaaaaame, when did you turn into such a bookworm?”

He knows why, of course. Everyone does, but its monumentally thoughtful of him not to bring it up; Theon isn’t exactly known for his tact.

“Well, we can’t all get by on good looks and charm,” she teases, punching his arm as the warning bell chimes.

Theon gives an exaggerated sigh. “It’s a tough job, but well, someone has to do it.”

She gives him the laugh he’s clearly expecting as they turn to head down the hall. Theon prattles on and Jon grabs her suddenly by the arm, tugging her back into the warmth of his chest just long enough to whisper, “Supply closet near the freshman bathrooms, after next period.”

She shivers, half melting into him as she nods. The smell of him makes her mouth water and her thighs clench. He releases her so quickly she barely has time to recover and by the time she turns he’s halfway down the opposite end of the hall.

summary:
Imagine: Being a
Baratheon who is in a relationship with Jon Snow.  Request: “Can i have a imagine where the reader is...
caption:
Imagine: Being a Baratheon who is in a relationship with Jon Snow.

Request: “Can i have a imagine where the reader is the daughter of Robert brotherton and Cersei and is best friends with sansa and in a relationship with jon please and thank you” For @rachelcarroll1819

Warning: Takes place during Season 7, so there will be very minor spoilers.

      You were standing on the balcony with your best friend, Sansa Stark, letting the snow fall down on you in gentle flakes.

      You were the daughter of Robert Baratheon and Cersei Lannister, and you had met Sansa during her time there. When Sansa was leaving, you asked her to take you with her, and she happily agreed.

      When Jon returned, you were overjoyed to be reunited with your past lover. You had met him when you first came to Winterfell with your family, and you hadn’t been able to forget him since.

      He was currently the one you were waiting for and Sansa was keeping you company.

      When he finally came out Sansa whispered, “I’ll leave you two alone.”    

      “So…”

      “So?” He repeats before the two of you fall into silence for a moment.

      “You’re really leaving?”

      “I must.”

      You simply nod at his response and look down at your feet. Jon sighs, gently putting his fingers under your chin and tilting your head up, “Love, you know I wouldn’t if I had a choice.”  

      “I know…” You pause for a moment, “Why don’t you take me with you.”

      “Because, we need the strongest women to stay in the North,” He says, causing you to smile.

      “Alright, but promise me that you will come back home.”

      “I promise, and I also promise that when I do come home, I will make you my Queen.”

      “I love you Jon.”

      “I love you too,” He whispers before leaning in to give you a kiss.

End.

Masterlist // Rules List // To-Do List

To be added or taken off a tag list, feel free to send my a message/ask.

Forever Tags: @nekodemon73 @2toastersbang @beahippie23 @addie-baby @hells-helvig @roseslovedreams @sebastianstanslefteyebrow @pinktrouble@killthe-illusionarydreams @all-by-myself98 @jaiboomer11  @m-a-t-91 @mimikyu-of-death @angels-and-things

Imagine: Being a Baratheon who is in a relationship with Jon Snow.

Request: “Can i have a imagine where the reader is the daughter of Robert brotherton and Cersei and is best friends with sansa and in a relationship with jon please and thank you” For @rachelcarroll1819

Warning: Takes place during Season 7, so there will be very minor spoilers.

      You were standing on the balcony with your best friend, Sansa Stark, letting the snow fall down on you in gentle flakes.

      You were the daughter of Robert Baratheon and Cersei Lannister, and you had met Sansa during her time there. When Sansa was leaving, you asked her to take you with her, and she happily agreed.

      When Jon returned, you were overjoyed to be reunited with your past lover. You had met him when you first came to Winterfell with your family, and you hadn’t been able to forget him since.

      He was currently the one you were waiting for and Sansa was keeping you company.

      When he finally came out Sansa whispered, “I’ll leave you two alone.”    

      “So…”

      “So?” He repeats before the two of you fall into silence for a moment.

      “You’re really leaving?”

      “I must.”

      You simply nod at his response and look down at your feet. Jon sighs, gently putting his fingers under your chin and tilting your head up, “Love, you know I wouldn’t if I had a choice.”  

      “I know…” You pause for a moment, “Why don’t you take me with you.”

      “Because, we need the strongest women to stay in the North,” He says, causing you to smile.

      “Alright, but promise me that you will come back home.”

      “I promise, and I also promise that when I do come home, I will make you my Queen.”

      “I love you Jon.”

      “I love you too,” He whispers before leaning in to give you a kiss.

End.

Masterlist // Rules List // To-Do List

To be added or taken off a tag list, feel free to send my a message/ask.

Forever Tags: @nekodemon73 @2toastersbang @beahippie23 @addie-baby @hells-helvig @roseslovedreams @sebastianstanslefteyebrow @pinktrouble@killthe-illusionarydreams @all-by-myself98 @jaiboomer11  @m-a-t-91 @mimikyu-of-death @angels-and-things

description:
Chapters: 1/10
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Jon Snow/Sansa Stark
Characters: Jon Snow, Sansa Stark, Rickon Stark, Bran Stark, Arya Stark, Robb Stark, Meera Reed, Jojen Reed
Additional Tags: YouTube, The Starks are YouTubers! Or at least Sansa and Rickon are, Social Media AU, Slow Burn, Cousin Incest, Jon is caught in the middle of Sansa and Rickon’s YouTube war–someone help him, The internet thirsts over Jon and Robb, They collectively throw the internet into heat

YouTube AU where Rickon plays a prank on Sansa and the internet starts shipping Jonsa because they don’t know they’re related.

For @archmaestergilly

blog.description: Welcome to the messy mind of an author, English teacher and maybe an adult. I post writing stuff sometimes. Mostly I reblog memes

summary: You wanna know what’s the funniest damn thing about this whole “Daenerys can’t have children” subplot. It’s that while yes, in...
body:
You wanna know what’s the funniest damn thing about this whole “Daenerys can’t have children” subplot. It’s that while yes, in the book, the witch mentions she will not have a living child again, in the show she does NOT. 

I’ve rewatched season one. The witch does not add that to her curse. Which means that they literally just decided to bring up “Daenerys is barren” JUST so they could do a surprise pregnancy reveal, even though her barreness was never set up in the first place and they realized that so they just started mentioning it a lot in hopes of tricking us. That’s some transparent foreshadowing right there.

summary:
jackoshadows
 replied to your post  “uh, well, you’re in the minority lmao if your whole beloved family was...”
                ...
body:
jackoshadows replied to your post “uh, well, you’re in the minority lmao if your whole beloved family was…”
@hereyesblueasice​ So the only thing Jon and Sansa talked about in that conversation was Sansa saying that she was not going back to Ramsay? Nothing else? There was no Sansa repeatedly telling Jon that he was going to lose and that Rickon was already dead and that Ramsay was better than Jon at this? None of that happened? Of course Jon was disturbed by that conversation considering that all Sansa did was discourage him on the eve of the battle!

THANK YOU, i was just about write up a long ass post saying all that shit. it’s like jonsas dont pay attention to anything for longer than it takes for sansa to stop speaking.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: GRRM’s original outline
title: GRRM’s original outline
body:
I have never really understood the argument that since GRRM originally planned for a Jon-Arya romantic relationship and a Jon-Arya-Tyrion love triangle, he has now replaced Arya with Sansa and that’s how we get Jonsa. Let’s get a few things straight here:

1.  THE STARK SISTERS ARE NOT INTERCHANGEABLE

2.  GRRM is still sticking to the story and ending he came up with in the early nineties. Jon and Arya still have a very, very close relationship as in the most recent book where Jon ends up dying to save Arya. Jon has almost no relationship with Sansa in the books and they are very indifferent and distant siblings who rarely think of each other and whose stories/plots have nothing to do with each other.

3. Sansa still betrays her family as per the original outline and Tyrion is not in love with her. Tyrion loved Shae while he was married to Sansa.

4. There is foreshadowing in the books for both Jon/Arya and Jon/Dany. Some of the most heartfelt love in the books is between Jon and Arya – what do you know of my heart, priestess? What do you know of my sister? Needle was Jon Snow’s smile. And between Jon and Dany the foreshadowing of - A blue flower grew from a chink in a wall of ice, and filled the air with sweetness.

5. Seeing as how Tyrion had a strange look on his face when Jon went into Dany’s room, it’s possible that we are actually getting some version of a Jon – Dany – Tyrion love triangle on the show next season and possibly in the books as well.

6. When GRRM originally intended for Jon and Arya to fall in love, it was a passion that TORMENTS them both because they dearly loved each other as siblings and that love was now turning into something else. GRRM is all about forbidden love. Jon’s oaths as a brother of the NW are also a big deal as he is sworn to celibacy. In the books, Jon finally breaks his oaths for Arya and chooses love over duty.

7. In the outline, Tyrion burns down Winterfell and Jon and Tyrion fight over Arya. In the books, Ramsay burns down Winterfell and Jon and Ramsay fight over fake Arya.

8. Jon constantly compares the women he is attracted to with Arya in the books. Ygritte and Val signify the tough, take no prisoners, pro-active women that Jon falls for. Dany would fit right in there as well – lonely, lovely and lethal. As recent as book 5, Jon espouses a dislike for girls like Sansa - A warrior princess, he decided, not some willowy creature who sits up in a tower, brushing her hair and waiting for some knight to rescue her.

9. The show putting Sansa in the North is often used to justify Jonsa. On the contrary, Sansa in the North had nothing to do with Jonsa and everything to do with David and Dan finding Sansa’s book plot too boring to adapt to TV and wanting to give Sophie Turner something meaty to do. As Benioff states :

And it’s because of Turner’s strength, Benioff continued, that it made sense to give Sansa a dramatic storyline this season and to use Ramsay’s engagement for that very purpose. In fact, the showrunners first thought about putting Sansa and Ramsay together back when they were writing season 2. “We really wanted Sansa to play a major part this season,” Benioff said. “If we were going to stay absolutely faithful to the book, it was going to be very hard to do that. There was a subplot we loved from the books, but it used a character that’s not in the show.” 

http://ew.com/article/2015/04/26/game-thrones-sansa-ramsay-interview/

So basically David and Dan wanted Sophie Turner/ Sansa to play a major role on the show, unlike in the books, and therefore put her in Winterfell instead of Jeyne Poole.Sansa’s story on the show will be different to her book one.

 So there it is. Please stop using the original outline to justify Jonsa. If we actually take the original outline into consideration then it does not bode well for Sansa at all. As per the outline Sansa is most likely doomed and is going to end the series dead. GRRM has always maintained that he knew the ending way back in the early nineties. It is possible he is going for Jon/Arya. Or he is intending for Jon/Dany. Either way one thing he is definitely not doing is Jon/Sansa considering how very little these characters have to do with each other in the books despite growing up as siblings.

As Benioff states :

And it’s because of Turner’s strength, Benioff continued, that it made sense to give Sansa a dramatic storyline this season and to use Ramsay’s engagement for that very purpose. In fact, the showrunners first thought about putting Sansa and Ramsay together back when they were writing season 2. “We really wanted Sansa to play a major part this season,” Benioff said. “If we were going to stay absolutely faithful to the book, it was going to be very hard to do that. There was a subplot we loved from the books, but it used a character that’s not in the show.” 

http://ew.com/article/2015/04/26/game-thrones-sansa-ramsay-interview/

So basically David and Dan wanted Sophie Turner/ Sansa to play a major role on the show, unlike in the books, and therefore put her in Winterfell instead of Jeyne Poole.Sansa’s story on the show will be different to her book one.

 So there it is. Please stop using the original outline to justify Jonsa. If we actually take the original outline into consideration then it does not bode well for Sansa at all. As per the outline Sansa is most likely doomed and is going to end the series dead. GRRM has always maintained that he knew the ending way back in the early nineties. It is possible he is going for Jon/Arya. Or he is intending for Jon/Dany. Either way one thing he is definitely not doing is Jon/Sansa considering how very little these characters have to do with each other in the books despite growing up as siblings.

summary: I was randomly talking with my sis about how Samwell Tarly is inspired by Samwise Gamgee in lotr (I believe this is canon and...
body: I was randomly talking with my sis about how Samwell Tarly is inspired by Samwise Gamgee in lotr (I believe this is canon and was said by GRRM but maybe I’m wrong idk) and by that it can only mean that Jon Snow is Frodo, and therefore will save the day and end up dead but maybe that’s just my ASOIAF tin foil hat talking cause GRRM is not releasing WOW and I’m going mad.

summary: How many Jonerys sex scenes do you think we will get in season 8? I'm thinking (hoping) one pre Jon's targaryen reveal, one...
body:
How many Jonerys sex scenes do you think we will get in season 8? I’m thinking (hoping) one pre Jon’s targaryen reveal, one after Jon’s Targaryen reveal (to show that she loves and accepts him and it better be sweet and loving as FUCK) and if we are truly blessed a third one before the big battle.

I’ve not read any spoilers and am trying to remain spoiler free so pls none of that. Thanks!
